DISCHARGE SUMMARY
**INSTITUTION
**PLACE , PA **ZIP-CODE
**NAME[AAA] JR , **NAME[BBB M]
**ID-NUM
**ID-NUM
A6B/637
SERVICE OF :
**NAME[ZZZ M YYY]
DATE OF ADMISSION :
**DATE[Apr 01 2007]
DATE OF DISCHARGE :
**DATE[Apr 05 2007]
DISPOSITION :
Inpatient hospice .
ADMISSION DIAGNOSIS :
Cerebrovascular accident .
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:
1. Cerebrovascular accident .
2. Hypertension .
3. History of coronary artery disease and depression .
CONSULTING PHYSICIANS:
1. Dr. **NAME[XXX] , ICU , pulmonary .
2. Dr. **NAME[WWW] , neurology .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
Mr. **NAME[AAA] is an **AGE[in 80s]- year-old gentleman who presented to the hospital via EMS after being found by his family unresponsive on the floor of his home .
CT of his head revealed a very large territory CVA involving the left MCA distribution .
The stroke was nonhemorrhagic .
He was left with dense hemiparesis and essentially comatose state .
He was treated in the intensive care unit without much improvement .
After lengthy discussion with the family , they have agreed to comfort measures only .
The patient was transferred to inpatient hospice for support of care .
DICTATED BY :
**NAME[VVV UUU] , R.N.
___________________
**NAME[ZZZ M. YYY] , M.D
Dict : **DATE[May 22 2007] 14:09:05
Tran : **DATE[May 23 2007] 01:26:22
**INITIALS
R : **DATE[May 23 2007] 01:26:22/km
**CARBON-COPY
